name: Social Trust Scale (ESS)
description: A 3-item measure of generalized social trust from the European Social Survey. Assesses trust in others, perceived fairness, and helpfulness of people in general.
reference: European Social Survey. (2018). ESS Round 9 Source Questionnaire. London: ESS ERIC Headquarters c/o City, University of London.
instructions: Using this card, please tell me how you feel about each statement.

questions.name: trust_ess_1
questions.description: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?

questions.name: trust_ess_2
questions.description: Do you think that most people would try to take advantage of you if they got the chance, or would they try to be fair?
questions.min_label: Most people would try to take advantage of me
questions.max_label: Most people would try to be fair

questions.name: trust_ess_3
questions.description: Would you say that most of the time people try to be helpful or that they are mostly looking out for themselves?
questions.min_label: People mostly look out for themselves
questions.max_label: People mostly try to be helpful
